addr.description: The base url of the Boundary API, e.g. "http://127.0.0.1:9200". If not set, it will be read from the "BOUNDARY_ADDR" env var.

auth_method_id.description: The auth method ID e.g. ampw_1234567890. If not set, the default auth method for the given scope ID will be used.

auth_method_login_name.description: The auth method login name for password-style or ldap-style auth methods

auth_method_password.description: The auth method password for password-style or ldap-style auth methods

password_auth_method_login_name.description: The auth method login name for password-style auth methods

password_auth_method_password.description: The auth method password for password-style auth methods

plugin_execution_dir.description: Specifies a directory that the Boundary provider can use to write and execute its built-in plugins.

recovery_kms_hcl.description: Can be a heredoc string or a path on disk. If set, the string/file will be parsed as HCL and used with the recovery KMS mechanism. While this is set, it will override any other authentication information; the KMS mechanism will always be used. See Boundary's KMS docs for examples: https://boundaryproject.io/docs/configuration/kms

scope_id.description: The scope ID for the default auth method.

tls_insecure.description: When set to true, does not validate the Boundary API endpoint certificate

token.description: The Boundary token to use, as a string or path on disk containing just the string. If set, the token read here will be used in place of authenticating with the auth method specified in "auth_method_id", although the recovery KMS mechanism will still override this. Can also be set with the BOUNDARY_TOKEN environment variable.

auth_method_id.description: The resource ID for the auth method.

login_name.description: The login name for this account.

name.description: The account name. Defaults to the resource name.

password.description: The account password. Only set on create, changes will not be reflected when updating account.

block.description: Deprecated: use `boundary_account_password` instead.

auth_method_id.description: The resource ID for the auth method.

login_name.description: The login name for this account.

name.description: The account name. Defaults to the resource name.

block.description: The account resource allows you to configure a Boundary account.

auth_method_id.description: The resource ID for the auth method.

name.description: The account name. Defaults to the resource name.

block.description: The account resource allows you to configure a Boundary account.

auth_method_id.description: The resource ID for the auth method.

login_name.description: The login name for this account.

name.description: The account name. Defaults to the resource name.

password.description: The account password. Only set on create, changes will not be reflected when updating account.

block.description: The account resource allows you to configure a Boundary account.

authorize_session_host_id.description: The host id to pass to Boundary when performing an authorize session action.

name.description: The alias name. Defaults to the resource name.

scope_id.description: The scope ID.

block.description: The target alias resource allows you to configure a Boundary target alias.

name.description: The auth method name. Defaults to the resource name.

scope_id.description: The scope ID.

block.description: The auth method resource allows you to configure a Boundary auth_method.

account_attribute_maps.description: Account attribute maps fullname and email.

anon_group_search.description: Use anon bind when performing LDAP group searches (optional).

bind_dn.description: The distinguished name of entry to bind when performing user and group searches (optional).

bind_password.description: The password to use along with bind-dn performing user and group searches (optional).

bind_password_hmac.description: The HMAC of the bind password returned by the Boundary controller, which is used for comparison after initial setting of the value.

certificates.description: PEM-encoded X.509 CA certificate in ASN.1 DER form that can be used as a trust anchor when connecting to an LDAP server(optional).  This may be specified multiple times

client_certificate.description: PEM-encoded X.509 client certificate in ASN.1 DER form that can be used to authenticate against an LDAP server(optional).

client_certificate_key.description: PEM-encoded X.509 client certificate key in PKCS #8, ASN.1 DER form used with the client certificate (optional).

client_certificate_key_hmac.description: The HMAC of the client certificate key returned by the Boundary controller, which is used for comparison after initial setting of the value.

dereference_aliases.description: Control how aliases are dereferenced when performing the search. Can be one of: NeverDerefAliases, DerefInSearching, DerefFindingBaseObj, and DerefAlways (optional).

discover_dn.description: Use anon bind to discover the bind DN of a user (optional).

enable_groups.description: Find the authenticated user's groups during authentication (optional).

group_attr.description: The attribute that enumerates a user's group membership from entries returned by a group search (optional).

group_dn.description: The base DN under which to perform group search.

group_filter.description: A go template used to construct a LDAP group search filter (optional).

id.description: The ID of the auth method.

insecure_tls.description: Skip the LDAP server SSL certificate validation (optional) - insecure and use with caution.

is_primary_for_scope.description: When true, makes this auth method the primary auth method for the scope in which it resides. The primary auth method for a scope means the the user will be automatically created when they login using an LDAP account.

maximum_page_size.description: MaximumPageSize specifies a maximum search result size to use when retrieving the authenticated user's groups (optional).

name.description: The auth method name. Defaults to the resource name.

scope_id.description: The scope ID.

state.description: Can be one of 'inactive', 'active-private', or 'active-public'. Defaults to active-public.

type.description: The type of auth method; hardcoded.

upn_domain.description: The userPrincipalDomain used to construct the UPN string for the authenticating user (optional).

urls.description: The LDAP URLs that specify LDAP servers to connect to (required).  May be specified multiple times.

use_token_groups.description: Use the Active Directory tokenGroups constructed attribute of the user to find the group memberships (optional).

user_attr.description: The attribute on user entry matching the username passed when authenticating (optional).

user_dn.description: The base DN under which to perform user search (optional).

user_filter.description: A go template used to construct a LDAP user search filter (optional).

block.description: The LDAP auth method resource allows you to configure a Boundary auth_method_ldap.

account_claim_maps.description: Account claim maps for the to_claim of sub.

allowed_audiences.description: Audiences for which the provider responses will be allowed

api_url_prefix.description: The API prefix to use when generating callback URLs for the provider. Should be set to an address at which the provider can reach back to the controller.

callback_url.description: The URL that should be provided to the IdP for callbacks.

client_id.description: The client ID assigned to this auth method from the provider.

client_secret.description: The secret key assigned to this auth method from the provider. Once set, only the hash will be kept and the original value can be removed from configuration.

client_secret_hmac.description: The HMAC of the client secret returned by the Boundary controller, which is used for comparison after initial setting of the value.

disable_discovered_config_validation.description: Disables validation logic ensuring that the OIDC provider's information from its discovery endpoint matches the information here. The validation is only performed at create or update time.

id.description: The ID of the auth method.

idp_ca_certs.description: A list of CA certificates to trust when validating the IdP's token signatures.

is_primary_for_scope.description: When true, makes this auth method the primary auth method for the scope in which it resides. The primary auth method for a scope means the user will be automatically created when they login using an OIDC account.

issuer.description: The issuer corresponding to the provider, which must match the issuer field in generated tokens.

max_age.description: The max age to provide to the provider, indicating how much time is allowed to have passed since the last authentication before the user is challenged again. A value of 0 sets an immediate requirement for all users to reauthenticate, and an unset maxAge results in a Terraform value of -1 and the default TTL of the chosen OIDC will be used.

name.description: The auth method name. Defaults to the resource name.

prompts.description: The prompts passed to the identity provider to determine whether to prompt the end-user for reauthentication, account selection or consent. Please note the values passed are case-sensitive. The valid values are: `none`, `login`, `consent` and `select_account`.

scope_id.description: The scope ID.

signing_algorithms.description: Allowed signing algorithms for the provider's issued tokens.

state.description: Can be one of 'inactive', 'active-private', or 'active-public'. Currently automatically set to active-public.

type.description: The type of auth method; hardcoded.

block.description: The OIDC auth method resource allows you to configure a Boundary auth_method_oidc.

name.description: The auth method name. Defaults to the resource name.

scope_id.description: The scope ID.

type.description: The resource type, hardcoded per resource

block.description: The auth method resource allows you to configure a Boundary auth_method_password.

credential_store_id.description: The credential store in which to save this json credential.

description.description: The description of this json credential.

id.description: The ID of this json credential.

name.description: The name of this json credential. Defaults to the resource name.

object.description: The object for the this json credential. Either values encoded with the "jsonencode" function, pre-escaped JSON string, or a file

block.description: The json credential resource allows you to congiure a credential using a json object.

credential_store_id.description: The ID of the credential store that this library belongs to.

credential_type.description: The type of credential the library generates. Cannot be updated on an existing resource.

http_method.description: The HTTP method the library uses when requesting credentials from Vault. Defaults to 'GET'

http_request_body.description: The body of the HTTP request the library sends to Vault when requesting credentials. Only valid if `http_method` is set to `POST`.

id.description: The ID of the Vault credential library.

name.description: The Vault credential library name. Defaults to the resource name.

path.description: The path in Vault to request credentials from.

block.description: The credential library for Vault resource allows you to configure a Boundary credential library for Vault.

additional_valid_principals.description: Principals to be signed as "valid_principles" in addition to username.

credential_store_id.description: The ID of the credential store that this library belongs to.

critical_options.description: Specifies a map of the critical options that the certificate should be signed for.

extensions.description: Specifies a map of the extensions that the certificate should be signed for.

id.description: The ID of the Vault credential library.

key_bits.description: Specifies the number of bits to use for the generated keys.

key_id.description: Specifies the key id a certificate should have.

key_type.description: Specifies the desired key type; must be ed25519, ecdsa, or rsa.

name.description: The Vault credential library name. Defaults to the resource name.

path.description: The path in Vault to request credentials from.

ttl.description: Specifies the requested time to live for a certificate returned from the library.

username.description: The username to use with the certificate returned by the library.

block.description: The credential library for Vault resource allows you to configure a Boundary credential library for Vault.

credential_store_id.description: ID of the credential store this credential belongs to.

name.description: The name of the credential. Defaults to the resource name.

private_key.description: The private key associated with the credential.

private_key_passphrase.description: The passphrase of the private key associated with the credential.

username.description: The username associated with the credential.

block.description: The SSH private key credential resource allows you to configure a credential using a username, private key and optional passphrase.

id.description: The ID of the static credential store.

name.description: The static credential store name. Defaults to the resource name.

scope_id.description: The scope for this credential store.

block.description: The static credential store resource allows you to configure a Boundary static credential store.

address.description: The address to Vault server. This should be a complete URL such as 'https://127.0.0.1:8200'

ca_cert.description: A PEM-encoded CA certificate to verify the Vault server's TLS certificate.

client_certificate.description: A PEM-encoded client certificate to use for TLS authentication to the Vault server.

client_certificate_key.description: A PEM-encoded private key matching the client certificate from 'client_certificate'.

client_certificate_key_hmac.description: The Vault client certificate key hmac.

id.description: The ID of the Vault credential store.

name.description: The Vault credential store name. Defaults to the resource name.

namespace.description: The namespace within Vault to use.

scope_id.description: The scope for this credential store.

tls_server_name.description: Name to use as the SNI host when connecting to Vault via TLS.

tls_skip_verify.description: Whether or not to skip TLS verification.

token.description: A token used for accessing Vault.

worker_filter.description: HCP Only. A filter used to control which PKI workers can handle Vault requests. This allows the use of private Vault instances with Boundary.

block.description: The credential store for Vault resource allows you to configure a Boundary credential store for Vault.

credential_store_id.description: The credential store in which to save this username/password credential.

description.description: The description of this username/password credential.

id.description: The ID of this username/password credential.

name.description: The name of this username/password credential. Defaults to the resource name.

password.description: The password of this username/password credential.

username.description: The username of this username/password credential.

block.description: The username/password credential resource allows you to configure a credential using a username and password pair.

member_ids.description: Resource IDs for group members, these are most likely boundary users.

name.description: The group name. Defaults to the resource name.

scope_id.description: The scope ID in which the resource is created. Defaults to the provider's `default_scope` if unset.

block.description: The group resource allows you to configure a Boundary group.

address.description: The static address of the host resource as `<IP>` (note: port assignment occurs in the target resource definition, do not add :port here) or a domain name.

name.description: The host name. Defaults to the resource name.

block.description: Deprecated: use `boundary_host_static` instead.

id.description: The ID of the host catalog.

name.description: The host catalog name. Defaults to the resource name.

scope_id.description: The scope ID in which the resource is created.

type.description: The host catalog type. Only `static` is supported.

block.description: Deprecated: use `boundary_host_catalog_static` instead.

attributes_json.description: The attributes for the host catalog. Either values encoded with the "jsonencode" function, pre-escaped JSON string, or a file:// or env:// path. Set to a string "null" or remove the block to clear all attributes in the host catalog.

id.description: The ID of the host catalog.

internal_force_update.description: Internal only. Used to force update so that we can always check the value of secrets.

internal_hmac_used_for_secrets_config_hm.description: Internal only. The Boundary-provided HMAC used to calculate the current value of the HMAC'd config. Used for drift detection.

internal_secrets_config_hmac.description: Internal only. HMAC of (serverSecretsHmac + config secrets). Used for proper secrets handling.

name.description: The host catalog name. Defaults to the resource name.

plugin_id.description: The ID of the plugin that should back the resource. This or plugin_name must be defined.

plugin_name.description: The name of the plugin that should back the resource. This or plugin_id must be defined.

scope_id.description: The scope ID in which the resource is created.

secrets_hmac.description: The HMAC'd secrets value returned from the server.

secrets_json.description: The secrets for the host catalog. Either values encoded with the "jsonencode" function, pre-escaped JSON string, or a file:// or env:// path. Set to a string "null" to clear any existing values. NOTE: Unlike "attributes_json", removing this block will NOT clear secrets from the host catalog; this allows injecting secrets for one call, then removing them for storage.

block.description: The host catalog resource allows you to configure a Boundary plugin-type host catalog. Host catalogs are always part of a project, so a project resource should be used inline or you should have the project ID in hand to successfully configure a host catalog.

id.description: The ID of the host catalog.

name.description: The host catalog name. Defaults to the resource name.

scope_id.description: The scope ID in which the resource is created.

block.description: The static host catalog resource allows you to configure a Boundary static-type host catalog. Host catalogs are always part of a project, so a project resource should be used inline or you should have the project ID in hand to successfully configure a host catalog.

host_catalog_id.description: The catalog for the host set.

host_ids.description: The list of host IDs contained in this set.

id.description: The ID of the host set.

name.description: The host set name. Defaults to the resource name.

block.description: Deprecated: use `boundary_host_set_static` instead.

attributes_json.description: The attributes for the host set. Either values encoded with the "jsonencode" function, pre-escaped JSON string, or a file:// or env:// path. Set to a string "null" or remove the block to clear all attributes in the host set.

host_catalog_id.description: The catalog for the host set.

id.description: The ID of the host set.

name.description: The host set name. Defaults to the resource name.

preferred_endpoints.description: The ordered list of preferred endpoints.

sync_interval_seconds.description: The value to set for the sync interval seconds.

block.description: The host_set_plugin resource allows you to configure a Boundary host set. Host sets are always part of a host catalog, so a host catalog resource should be used inline or you should have the host catalog ID in hand to successfully configure a host set.

host_catalog_id.description: The catalog for the host set.

host_ids.description: The list of host IDs contained in this set.

id.description: The ID of the host set.

name.description: The host set name. Defaults to the resource name.

block.description: The host_set_static resource allows you to configure a Boundary host set. Host sets are always part of a host catalog, so a host catalog resource should be used inline or you should have the host catalog ID in hand to successfully configure a host set.

address.description: The static address of the host resource as `<IP>` (note: port assignment occurs in the target resource definition, do not add :port here) or a domain name.

name.description: The host name. Defaults to the resource name.

block.description: The static host resource allows you to configure a Boundary static host. Hosts are always part of a project, so a project resource should be used inline or you should have the project ID in hand to successfully configure a host.

auth_method_id.description: The resource ID for the auth method.

filter.description: Boolean expression to filter the workers for this managed group.

name.description: The managed group name. Defaults to the resource name.

block.description: The managed group resource allows you to configure a Boundary group.

auth_method_id.description: The resource ID for the auth method.

group_names.description: The list of groups that make up the managed group.

name.description: The managed group name. Defaults to the resource name.

block.description: The managed group resource allows you to configure a Boundary group.

delete_after_days.description: The number of days after which a session recording will be automatically deleted. Defaults to 0: never automatically delete. However, delete_after_days and retain_for_days cannot both be 0.

delete_after_overridable.description: Whether or not the associated delete_after_days value can be overridden by org scopes. Note: if the associated delete_after_days value is 0, overridable is ignored

name.description: The policy name. Defaults to the resource name.

retain_for_days.description: The number of days a session recording is required to be stored. Defaults to 0: allow deletions at any time. However, retain_for_days and delete_after_days cannot both be 0.

retain_for_overridable.description: Whether or not the associated retain_for_days value can be overridden by org scopes. Note: if the associated retain_for_days value is 0, overridable is ignored.

scope_id.description: The scope for this policy.

block.description: The storage policy resource allows you to configure a Boundary storage policy. Storage policies allow an admin to configure how long session recordings must be stored and when to delete them. Storage policies must be applied to the global scope or an org scope in order to take effect.

grant_scope_id.description: For Boundary 0.15+, use `grant_scope_ids` instead. The scope for which the grants in the role should apply.

grant_scope_ids.description: A list of scopes for which the grants in this role should apply, which can include the special values "this", "children", or "descendants"

grant_strings.description: A list of stringified grants for the role.

name.description: The role name. Defaults to the resource name.

principal_ids.description: A list of principal (user or group) IDs to add as principals on the role.

scope_id.description: The scope ID in which the resource is created. Defaults to the provider's `default_scope` if unset.

block.description: The role resource allows you to configure a Boundary role.

auto_create_admin_role.description: If set, when a new scope is created, the provider will not disable the functionality that automatically creates a role in the new scope and gives permissions to manage the scope to the provider's user. Marking this true makes for simpler HCL but results in role resources that are unmanaged by Terraform.

auto_create_default_role.description: Only relevant when creating an org scope. If set, when a new scope is created, the provider will not disable the functionality that automatically creates a role in the new scope and gives listing of scopes and auth methods and the ability to authenticate to the anonymous user. Marking this true makes for simpler HCL but results in role resources that are unmanaged by Terraform.

global_scope.description: Indicates that the scope containing this value is the global scope, which triggers some specialized behavior to allow it to be imported and managed.

name.description: The scope name. Defaults to the resource name.

scope_id.description: The scope ID containing the sub scope resource.

block.description: The scope resource allows you to configure a Boundary scope.

attributes_json.description: The attributes for the storage bucket. The "region" attribute field is required when creating an AWS storage bucket. Values are either encoded with the "jsonencode" function, pre-escaped JSON string, or a file:// or env:// path. Set to a string "null" or remove the block to clear all attributes in the storage bucket.

bucket_name.description: The name of the bucket within the external object store service.

bucket_prefix.description: The prefix used to organize the data held within the external object store.

id.description: The ID of the storage bucket.

internal_force_update.description: Internal only. Used to force update so that we can always check the value of secrets.

internal_hmac_used_for_secrets_config_hm.description: Internal only. The Boundary-provided HMAC used to calculate the current value of the HMAC'd config. Used for drift detection.

internal_secrets_config_hmac.description: Internal only. HMAC of (serverSecretsHmac + config secrets). Used for proper secrets handling.

name.description: The storage bucket name. Defaults to the resource name.

plugin_id.description: The ID of the plugin that should back the resource. This or plugin_name must be defined.

plugin_name.description: The name of the plugin that should back the resource. This or plugin_id must be defined.

scope_id.description: The scope for this storage bucket.

secrets_hmac.description: The HMAC'd secrets value returned from the server.

secrets_json.description: The secrets for the storage bucket. Either values encoded with the "jsonencode" function, pre-escaped JSON string, or a file:// or env:// path. Set to a string "null" to clear any existing values. NOTE: Unlike "attributes_json", removing this block will NOT clear secrets from the storage bucket; this allows injecting secrets for one call, then removing them for storage.

worker_filter.description: Filters to the worker(s) that can handle requests for this storage bucket. The filter must match an existing worker in order to create a storage bucket.

block.description: The storage bucket resource allows you to configure a Boundary storage bucket. A storage bucket can only belong to the Global scope or an Org scope. At this time, the only supported storage for storage buckets is AWS S3. This feature requires Boundary Enterprise or Boundary HCP.

address.description: Optionally, a valid network address to connect to for this target. Cannot be used alongside host_source_ids.

brokered_credential_source_ids.description: A list of brokered credential source ID's.

default_client_port.description: The default client port for this target.

default_port.description: The default port for this target.

egress_worker_filter.description: Boolean expression to filter the workers used to access this target

enable_session_recording.description: HCP/Ent Only. Enable sessions recording for this target. Only applicable for SSH targets.

host_source_ids.description: A list of host source ID's. Cannot be used alongside address.

ingress_worker_filter.description: HCP Only. Boolean expression to filter the workers a user will connect to when initiating a session against this target

injected_application_credential_source_i.description: A list of injected application credential source ID's.

name.description: The target name. Defaults to the resource name.

scope_id.description: The scope ID in which the resource is created. Defaults to the provider's `default_scope` if unset.

storage_bucket_id.description: HCP/Ent Only. Storage bucket for this target. Only applicable for SSH targets.

worker_filter.description: Boolean expression to filter the workers for this target

block.description: The target resource allows you to configure a Boundary target.

account_ids.description: Account ID's to associate with this user resource.

name.description: The username. Defaults to the resource name.

scope_id.description: The scope ID in which the resource is created. Defaults to the provider's `default_scope` if unset.

block.description: The user resource allows you to configure a Boundary user.

address.description: The accessible address of the self managed worker.

authorized_actions.description: A list of actions that the worker is entitled to perform.

controller_generated_activation_token.description: A single use token generated by the controller to be passed to the self-managed worker.

name.description: The name for the worker.

release_version.description: The version of the Boundary binary running on the self managed worker.

scope_id.description: The scope for the worker. Defaults to `global`.

worker_generated_auth_token.description: The worker authentication token required to register the worker for the worker-led authentication flow. Leaving this blank will result in a controller generated token.

block.description: The resource allows you to create a self-managed worker object.

auth_method_id.description: The auth method ID that will be queried for the account.

description.description: The description of the retrieved account.

id.description: The ID of the retrieved account.

name.description: The name of the account to retrieve.

block.description: The boundary_account data source allows you to find a Boundary account.

description.description: The description of the retrieved auth method.

id.description: The ID of the retrieved auth method.

name.description: The name of the auth method to retrieve.

scope_id.description: The scope ID in which the resource is created. Defaults `global` if unset.

type.description: The type of the auth method

block.description: The boundary_auth_method data source allows you to find a Boundary auth method.

description.description: The description of the retrieved group.

id.description: The ID of the retrieved group.

member_ids.description: Resource IDs for group members, these are most likely boundary users.

name.description: The name of the group to retrieve.

scope_id.description: The scope ID in which the resource is created. Defaults `global` if unset.

block.description: The boundary_group data source allows you to find a Boundary group.

description.description: The description of the retrieved scope.

id.description: The ID of the retrieved scope.

name.description: The name of the scope to retrieve.

scope_id.description: The parent scope ID that will be queried for the scope.

block.description: The scope data source allows you to discover an existing Boundary scope by name.

account_ids.description: Account ID's to associate with this user resource.

authorized_actions.description: A list of actions that the worker is entitled to perform.

name.description: The username to search for.

scope_id.description: The scope ID in which the resource is created. Defaults `global` if unset.

block.description: The user data source allows you to find a Boundary user.
